body_html:
When I'm compiling @pedropgusmao 's tests, similar as for him, no problem for ptrdiff_t ie for me it is signed as it should be.
That is on rhel7 gcc 4.8.5.
So this might be specific to minicloud? I'm checking whether we can give you access to an IBM machine.
If ptrdiff_t is unsigned on your test machine, does that mean it is incorrecly defined in the Linux header files?
In accordance with the ELFV2 ABI, the definition of ptrdiff_t should be
• typedef long long ptrdiff_t;

body:
When I'm compiling @pedropgusmao 's tests, similar as for him, no problem for `ptrdiff_t` ie for me it is signed as it should be.
That is on rhel7 gcc 4.8.5.
So this might be specific to  minicloud? I'm checking whether we can give you access to an IBM machine.
If `ptrdiff_t` is unsigned on your test machine, does that mean it is incorrecly defined in the Linux header files?
In accordance with the ELFV2 ABI, the definition of `ptrdiff_t` should be
`• typedef long long ptrdiff_t;`
